info.title: Swagger Json
info.description: This is a generated swagger json for your sails project

tags.name: Inventory
tags.description: Sails blueprint actions for the **Inventory** model

tags.name: Shop
tags.description: Sails blueprint actions for the **Shop** model

tags.name: Stats
tags.description: Sails blueprint actions for the **Stats** model

tags.name: Vending
tags.description: Sails blueprint actions for the **Vending** model

shop.description: JSON dictionary representing the **shop** instance or FK when creating / updating / not populated

inventory.description: Array of **inventory**'s or array of FK's when creating / updating / not populated

vending.description: Array of **vending**'s or array of FK's when creating / updating / not populated

stats.description: JSON dictionary representing the **stats** instance or FK when creating / updating / not populated

shop.description: JSON dictionary representing the **shop** instance or FK when creating / updating / not populated

emailStatus.description: The confirmation status of the user's email address.

emailChangeCandidate.description: A still-unconfirmed email address that this user wants to change to (if relevant).

password.description: Securely hashed representation of the user's login password.

fullName.description: Full representation of the user's name.

isSuperAdmin.description: Whether this user is a "super admin" with extra permissions, etc.

passwordResetToken.description: A unique token used to verify the user's identity when recovering a password.  Expires after 1 use, or after a set amount of time has elapsed.

passwordResetTokenExpiresAt.description: A JS timestamp (epoch ms) representing the moment when this user's `passwordResetToken` will expire (or 0 if the user currently has no such token).

emailProofToken.description: A pseudorandom, probabilistically-unique token for use in our account verification emails.

emailProofTokenExpiresAt.description: A JS timestamp (epoch ms) representing the moment when this user's `emailProofToken` will expire (or 0 if the user currently has no such token).

stripeCustomerId.description: The id of the customer entry in Stripe associated with this user (or empty string if this user is not linked to a Stripe customer -- e.g. if billing features are not enabled).

hasBillingCard.description: Whether this user has a default billing card hooked up as their payment method.

billingCardBrand.description: The brand of this user's default billing card (or empty string if no billing card is set up).

billingCardLast4.description: The last four digits of the card number for this user's default billing card (or empty string if no billing card is set up).

billingCardExpMonth.description: The two-digit expiration month from this user's default billing card, formatted as MM (or empty string if no billing card is set up).

billingCardExpYear.description: The four-digit expiration year from this user's default billing card, formatted as YYYY (or empty string if no credit card is set up).

tosAcceptedByIp.description: The IP (ipv4) address of the request that accepted the terms of service.

lastSeenAt.description: A JS timestamp (epoch ms) representing the moment at which this user most recently interacted with the backend while logged in (or 0 if they have not interacted with the backend at all yet).

shop.description: JSON dictionary representing the **shop** instance or FK when creating / updating / not populated

AttributeFilterParam.description: To filter results based on a particular attribute, specify a query parameter with the same name as the attribute defined on your model. For instance, if our `Purchase` model has an `amount` attribute, we could send `GET /purchase?amount=99.99` to return a list of $99.99 purchases.

WhereQueryParam.name: where
WhereQueryParam.description:
Instead of filtering based on a specific attribute, you may instead choose to provide a `where` parameter with the WHERE piece of a [Waterline criteria](https://sailsjs.com/documentation/concepts/models-and-orm/query-language), _encoded as a JSON string_. This allows you to take advantage of `contains`, `startsWith`, and other sub-attribute criteria modifiers for more powerful `find()` queries.

e.g. `?where={"name":{"contains":"theodore"}}`

LimitQueryParam.name: limit
LimitQueryParam.description: The maximum number of records to send back (useful for pagination). Defaults to 30.

SkipQueryParam.name: skip
SkipQueryParam.description: The number of records to skip (useful for pagination).

SortQueryParam.name: sort
SortQueryParam.description:
The sort order. By default, returned records are sorted by primary key value in ascending order.

e.g. `?sort=lastName%20ASC`

oneOf.description: Success
The requesting user is already logged in.
Success
The requesting user is already logged in.

get.description:
Confirm a new user's email address, or an existing user's request for an email address change,
then redirect to either a special landing page (for newly-signed up users), or the account page
(for existing users who just changed their email address).

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: The confirmation token from the email.

oneOf.description: Email address confirmed and requesting user logged in.
Email address confirmed and requesting user logged in.  Since this looks like a browser, redirecting...
The provided token is expired, invalid, or already used up.

409.description: The email address is no longer available.

oneOf.description: Success
The requesting user is already logged in.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: The password reset token from the email.

oneOf.description: Success
The provided token is expired, invalid, or has already been used.

post.description: Deliver a contact form message to the appropriate internal channel(s).

parameters.name: emailAddress
parameters.description: A return email address where we can respond.

parameters.name: topic
parameters.description: The topic from the contact form.

parameters.name: fullName
parameters.description: The full name of the human sending this message.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The custom message, in plain text.

post.description: Subscribe to the logged-in user's session so that you receive socket broadcasts when logged out in another tab.

200.description: The requesting socket is now subscribed to socket broadcasts about the logged-in user's session.
Responds with a JSON dictionary representing the newly created **Shop** instance

400.description: Validation errors; details in JSON response

requestBody.description: JSON dictionary representing the Shop instance to create.

get.description: Find a list of **Shop** records that match the specified criteria.

parameters.name: select
parameters.description: The attributes to include in the result, specified as a comma-delimited list. By default, all attributes are selected. Not valid for plural (“collection”) association attributes.

parameters.name: omit
parameters.description: The attributes to exclude from the result, specified as a comma-delimited list. Cannot be used in conjuction with `select`. Not valid for plural (“collection”) association attributes.

parameters.name: populate
parameters.description: If specified, overide the default automatic population process. Accepts a comma-separated list of attribute names for which to populate record values, or specify `false` to have no attributes populated.

200.description: Responds with a paged list of **Shop** records that match the specified criteria

put.description: Update the password for the logged-in user.
Update the profile for the logged-in user.

409.description: The provided email address is already in use.

put.description: Update the credit card for the logged-in user.

parameters.name: stripeToken
parameters.description: The single-use Stripe Checkout token identifier representing the user's payment source (i.e. credit card.)

put.description: Log in using the provided email and password combination.

parameters.name: emailAddress
parameters.description: The email to try in this attempt, e.g. "irl@example.com".

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: The unencrypted password to try in this attempt, e.g. "passwordlol".

parameters.name: rememberMe
parameters.description: Whether to extend the lifetime of the user's session.

oneOf.description: The requesting user agent has been successfully logged in.

The provided email and password combination does not
      match any user in the database.

post.description: Sign up for a new user account.

parameters.name: emailAddress
parameters.description: The email address for the new account, e.g. m@example.com.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: The unencrypted password to use for the new account.

oneOf.description: New user account was created successfully.
The provided fullName, password and/or email address are invalid.

409.description: The provided email address is already in use.

post.description: Send a password recovery notification to the user with the specified email address.

parameters.name: emailAddress
parameters.description: The email address of the alleged user who wants to recover their password.

200.description: The email address might have matched a user in the database.  (If so, a recovery email was sent.)

post.description: Finish the password recovery flow by setting the new password and logging in the requesting user, based on the authenticity of their token.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: The password token that was generated by the `sendPasswordRecoveryEmail` endpoint.
